If all fruits and vegetables disappeared, it would be difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals as they are the primary sources of these nutrients. However, there are alternative sources of vitamins and minerals that could be used as substitutes. For example, some vitamins like Vitamin A and Vitamin D can be obtained from animal products such as dairy and meat. Other vitamins like Vitamin C and Vitamin B6 can be obtained from fortified foods such as cereals and bread. Additionally, some minerals like iron and calcium can be obtained from plant-based sources such as beans and leafy greens.

Another way to obtain essential vitamins and minerals would be through supplements. There are many vitamin and mineral supplements available on the market that can provide the necessary nutrients. However, it is important to note that supplements should not be relied upon as the sole source of nutrition and should be used in conjunction with a balanced diet.

In the absence of fruits and vegetables, it may be necessary to turn to alternative sources of nutrition such as seafood. Fish such as salmon and sardines are rich in Omega-3 fatty acids and other essential nutrients. Additionally, seaweed such as kombu and nori are also good sources of vitamins and minerals.

Another option would be to turn to plant-based sources of protein such as legumes and nuts. These foods are high in protein and can provide a good source of essential amino acids. Additionally, they are also good sources of vitamins and minerals.

Finally, it may be necessary to turn to alternative sources of nutrition such as fermented foods. Fermented foods such as kimchi and sauerkraut are rich in probiotics and can provide a good source of essential vitamins and minerals. Additionally, they can also help improve digestion and boost the immune system.
